newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Sept 20.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Sept 20.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:

** The Dow Jones industrial average closed 9.62 points lower at 5,867.74 on Thursday as strong economic reports have bolstered prospects that the Federal Reserve will raise interest rates next week to keep inflation in check.
** Indonesia's Lippo group said on Thursday it will sweeten the terms of its restructuring of its financial services group with a new six-point plan.
** The Jakarta Composite Index rose 5.87 points, or 1.05 percent, to close at 565.56 points on Thursday on the back of active foreign buying of various blue chips.
** On Friday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,318.25/18.60 in early trading against an opening of 2,318.00/20.00.
** Lippo Securities, Lippo Life and Lippo Bank of the Lippo Group after the announcement on Thursday to sweeten terms of its restructuring plan.
** Property firm Jababeka on market talk the firm had signed a deal with a Singapore-based firm to develop and operate an industrial park in West Java.
** Astra on market talk of a possible take over and rights issue. The firm denied to comment on the take-over talk and said there was no plan to announce rights issue.
** Photographic equipment distributor Inter Delta on market talk of a possible acquisition.
